page.title: 10Tourism - Beauty Spots
page.content: This area is one of the seven wonders of Rochdale. Approx. four and a half miles out of the busy town. Blackstone Egde holds a variety of hills for the fell-walker. For the naturalist there is a nature trail over Hardcastle Crags, where you can see the many species of animals which make the moors their habitat. For the person interested in History and Heritage, there is a Roman road running over Blackstone Edge. Springfield Park approx. two miles from the town centre has amenities for all age-ranges. These include a children's playground and miniature railway; tennis courts; an athletic track; a full size golf course; besides plenty of benches for those who simply want to relax and enjoy the scenery.
